It can strike any creature as if it were magically enchanted and made of silver, iron, or other materials required to overcome immunities or resistances. An eater of dust always knows the location of its mawblade as if using the locate creature spell.
description |Multiattack| The eater of dust makes two mawblade attacks, or makes one mawblade attack and casts inflict wounds.

description |Mawblade| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, one target. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

title: Edimmu
contents: property | Damage Resistances| Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities| Charmed, Exhaustion, Grappled, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious
property | Language | Common but can't speak

description |Rejuvenation| If destroyed, an edimmu rises again in 2d4 days. Permanently destroying one requires properly burying its mortal remains in consecrated or hallowed ground. Edimmus rarely venture more than a mile from the place of their death.
description |Incorporeal Movement| Can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

title: Edimmu Continued: Actions
contents: description |Water Siphon| Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken and it is stunned for 1 minute and gains one level of exhaustion. A stunned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the stun on itself on a success. The hit point reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest and drinks abundant water or until it is affected by greater restoration or comparable magic. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

title: Einherjar
contents: property | Armor class | 18 (chain mail and shield)
property | Skills | Animal Handling +5, Intimidation +6, Perception +5
property | Senses | Darkvision 60ft, Truesight 60ft, Passive Perc. 15

description |Asgardian Battleaxes| Made in Valhalla and kept keen with runic magic, Asgardian axes have a +2 enchantment and add a second die of weapon damage. Their magic must be renewed each week by a valkyrie or Odin's own hand.
description |Battle Loving| Einherjars relish combat and never turn down a challenge to single combat or shirk a fight, even if the odds are hopeless. After all, Valhalla awaits them.
description |Battle Frenzy| Once reduced to 30 hp or less, einherjar make all attacks with advantage.
description |Fearsome Gaze| The stare of an einherjar is especially piercing and intimidating. They make Intimidation checks with advantage.

title: Einherjar Continued: Actions
contents: description |Innate Spellcasting| The einherjar's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
description |Multiattack| An einherjar makes three attacks with its Asgardian battleaxe or one with its handaxe.
description |Asgardian Battleaxe| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage when used one handed or 17 (2d10 + 6) when used two-handed.
description |Handaxe| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

title: Eleinomae
contents: property | Saving Throws | Str +4, Dex +7, Con +6, Int +5, Wis +5, Cha +7
property | Language | Aquan, Common, Elvish, Sylvan
description |Unearthly Grace| The eleinomae's Charisma modifier is added to its armor class (included above).
description |Reed Walk| The eleinomae can move across undergrowth or rivers without making an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain of this kind doesn't cost it extra moment.
description |Innate Spellcasting| The eleinomae's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

title: Eleinomae Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The eleinomae makes three dagger attacks and one reed flower net attack.
description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

description |Reed Flower Net| Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws for 1 minute, and is restrained. A creature can free itself or another creature within reach from restraint by using an action to make a successful DC 15 Strength check or by doing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10).

title: Elemental Locus
contents: property | Saving Throws | Int +6, Wis +6, Cha +6
property | Damage Immunities | Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Poison, Thunder
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Unconscious
property | Senses | Darkvision 120ft, Tremorsense 120ft, Passive Perc. 16
description |Magic Resistance| The elemental locus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

description |Immortal| Does not age and does not die when it drops to 0 hit points. If the elemental locus drops to 0 hit points, it falls into a quiescent state for 25 weeks before returning to activity with full hit points. Its spawned elementals continue fighting whatever enemies attacked the elemental locus; if no enemies are present, they defend the locus's area.

title: Elemental Locus Continued: Actions
contents: description |Massive| The elemental locus is larger than most Gargantuan creatures, occupying a space of 60 by 60 feet. Its movement is not affected by difficult terrain or by Huge or smaller creatures. Other creatures can enter and move through the elemental locus's space, but they must make a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check after each 10 feet of movement. Failure indicates they fall prone and can move no farther that turn.

description |Spawn Elementals| As a bonus action, the elemental locus loses 82 hit points and spawns an air, earth, fire, or water elemental to serve it. Spawned elementals answer to their creator's will and are not fully independent. The types of elementals the locus can spawn depend on the terrain it embodies; for example, an elemental locus of the desert can spawn earth, fire, and air elementals, but not water.
description |Siege Monster| The elemental locus deals double damage to objects and structures.
description |Multiattack| The elemental locus makes two slam attacks.

description |Slam| Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 36 (6d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 23 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

title: Shadow Fey
contents: description |Fey Ancestry| The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.
description |Innate Spellcasting| The shadow fey's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components.
bullet |1/day:| misty step (when in shadows, dim light, or darkness only)
description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

title: Shadow Fey Continued: Actions
contents: description |Traveler in Darkness| The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.
description |Shortsword| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.
description |Shortbow| Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

title: Shadow Fey Duelist
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +8, Con + 5, Wis + 4, Cha +6
property | Skills | Arcana +4, Deception +6, Perception +4, Stealth +8
description |Fey Ancestry| Has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.
description |Innate Spellcasting| Innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components.
bullet |3/day:| misty step (shadows, dim light, or darkness only)
description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Traveler in Darkness| The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.

title: Shadow Fey Duelist Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The shadow fey makes two rapier attacks. If it has a dagger drawn, it can also make one dagger attack.

description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage, and a target creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
description |Rapier| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.
description |Parry| The shadow fey duelist adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the duelist must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

title: Shadow Fey Enchantress
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +5, Wis +6, Cha +7
property | Skills | Arcana +4, Deception +7, Perception +6, Persuasion +7, Stealth +5
description |Fey Ancestry| The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put her to sleep.
description |Innate Spellcasting| The shadow fey's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. She can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components.
bullet |4/day:| misty step (when in shadows, dim light, or darkness only)

title: Shadow Fey Enchantress Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Spellcasting| The shadow fey is a 10th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). She knows the following bard spells.
bullet |5th level (2 slots):| animate objects, dominate person, hold monster
description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Traveler in Darkness| The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.

title: Shadow Fey Enchantress Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The shadow fey makes two rapier attacks.
description |Rapier| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) psychic damage.

description |Beguiling Whispers (recharge 5-6)| The shadow fey speaks sweet words to a creature she can see within 60 feet, that can hear the enchantress. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be charmed for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws made to resist spells cast by the enchantress.

description |Leadership (recharges after a Short or Long Rest)| The enchantress can utter a special command or warning to a creature she can see within 30 feet of her. The creature must not be hostile to the enchantress and it must be able to hear (the command is inaudible to all but the target creature). For 1 minute, the creature adds a d4 to its attack rolls and saving throws. A creature can benefit from only one enchantress's Leadership at a time. This effect ends if the enchantress is incapacitated.

title: Shadow Fey Forest Hunter
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +7, Con +4, Cha +6
property | Skills | Arcana +3, Perception +4, Stealth +10, Survival +4
description |Fey Ancestry| The shadow fey has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.
description |Innate Spellcasting| The shadow fey's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components.
bullet |3/day:| misty step (when in shadows, dim light, or darkness only)

title: Shadow Fey Enchantress Continued: Actions
contents: description |Sneak Attack (1/turn)| The shadow fey forest hunter does an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack that had advantage, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the forest hunter that isn't incapacitated and the forest hunter doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Traveler in Darkness| The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.
description |Multiattack| The shadow fey makes two ranged attacks.
description |Rapier| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.
description |Longbow| Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

title: Shadow Fey Guardian
contents: description |Fey Ancestry| The shadow fey guardian has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep
description |Innate Spellcasting| The shadow fey's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can cast the following spells innately, requiring no material components.
bullet |1/day:| misty step (when in shadows, dim light, or darkness only)
description |Shadow's Vigil| The shadow fey has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, and magical darkness does not inhibit its darkvision.

title: Shadow Fey Guardian Continued: Actions
contents: description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the shadow fey has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Traveler in Darkness| The shadow fey has advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to know about shadow roads and shadow magic spells or items.
description |Multiattack| The shadow fey makes two pike attacks.
description |Pike| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.
description |Javelin| Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.
description |Protect| The shadow fey guardian imposes disadvantage on an attack roll against an ally within 5 feet. The guardian must be wielding a melee weapon to use this reaction.

title: Emerald Eye
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +4, Con +4, Int +4
property | Skills | Acrobatics +4, Arcana +4, Deception +5, History +4, Perception +3, Persuasion +5, Religion +4
property | Damage Resistances | Cold, Fire; Piercing damage
property | Condition Immunities | Blinded, Deafened, Exhausted, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Unconscious
property | Language | Common, Draconic; Telepathy 250 ft.

description |Bound| An emerald eye cannot move more than 25 feet away from the creature that it is psychically linked to. It begins existence bound to its creator, but a free emerald eye can bind itself to another creature as in the Bind action.
description |Immutable Form| The emerald eye is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

title: Emerald Eye Continued: Actions
contents: description |Slash| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (5d4 + 2) slashing damage.

description |Attraction (Recharge 5-6)| An emerald eye can compel one creature to move toward a particular person or object. If the creature fails a DC 13 Charisma saving throw, it feels a powerful compulsion to move toward whatever the emerald eye chooses. The target creature must be within 25 feet of the emerald eye when attraction is triggered, but the creature is then free to move beyond this range while remaining under the effect. Nothing seems out of the ordinary to the creature, but it does not knowingly put itself or its allies in harm's way to reach the object. The creature may attempt another DC 13 Charisma saving throw at the start of each of its turns; a success ends the effect.

description |Bind (3/Day)| The emerald eye can bind itself psychically to a creature with an Intelligence of 6 or greater. The attempt fails if the target succeeds on a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. The attempt is unnoticed by the target, regardless of the result.

description |Telepathic Lash (3/Day)| An emerald eye can overwhelm one humanoid creature within 25 feet with emotions and impulses the creature is hard-pressed to control. If the target fails a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, it is stunned for 1 round.

title: Empty Cloak
contents: property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
property | Language | understands Elvish and Umbral but can't speak
description |Diligent Sentinel| Empty cloaks are designed to watch for intruders. They gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.
description |Shadow Construction| Empty cloaks are designed with a delicate shadow construction. They burst into pieces, then dissipate into shadow, on a critical hit.

title: Empty Cloak Continued: Actions
contents: description |Wrapping Embrace| Empty cloaks can share the same space as one Medium or smaller creature. The empty cloak has advantage on attack rolls against any creature in the same space with it.
description |Razor Cloak| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.
description |Shadow Slam| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

description |Shadow Snare| Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: Large or smaller creatures are restrained. To escape, the restrained creature or an adjacent ally must use an action to make a successful DC 14 Strength check. The shadow snare has 15 hit points and AC 12.

title: Eonic Drifter
contents: property | Language | Common, Eonic, Giant, Sylvan

description |Multiattack| The eonic drifter can either use Drift Backward or make two attacks with its time warping staff. The eonic drifter's future self (if present) can only use Drift Forward.Time Warping Staff. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

description |Drift Backward (1/Day)| Future version appears in 30ft of the drifter. Has same stats and its full hit points, and it takes its turn immediately after its present self. Killing the original eonic drifter makes its future self disappear. If the present self sees its future self die, makes DC 13 Wisdom save. Failure: roll 1d6 to determine the effect on the eonic drifter: 1 = frightened, 2 = incapacitated, 3 = paralyzed, 4 = unconscious, 5 or 6 = has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. These effects last 1d4 rounds.

title: Eonic Drifter Continued: Actions
contents: description |Drift Forward (2/Day)| The future self makes a time warping staff attack against a target. If the attack hits, instead of causing bludgeoning damage, both the target and the attacker jump forward through time, effectively ceasing to exist in the present time. They reappear in the same locations 1d4 rounds later, at the end of the present self's turn. Creatures occupying those locations at that moment are pushed 5 feet in a direction of their own choosing. The target of the drift (but not the future self) must then make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw, with effects identical to those for the eonic drifter witnessing the death of its future self (see Drift Backward). The future self doesn't reappear after using this ability the second time; only the target of the drift reappears from the second use. This does not trigger a saving throw for the present self.

title: Erina Scrounger
contents: description |Keen Smell| The erina has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
description |Hardy| Has advantage on saving throws against poison.
description |Spines| An enemy who hits the erina with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 (1d4) piercing damage.
description |Dagger| Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.
description |Sling| Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

title: Far Darrig
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +5, Con +7, Cha +7
property | Skills | Nature +4, Animal Handling +6, Medicine +6, Perception +6, Survival +6
description |Innate Spellcasting| Spellcasting ability is Charisma (DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
bullet |Constant:| magic weapon (antler glaive only), speak with animals
bullet |At will:| calm emotions, charm animal (as charm person but affects beasts only), cure wounds, detect poison and disease, water breathing, water walk
bullet |3/day each:| barkskin, conjure woodland beings, hold animal (as hold person but affects beasts only), jump, longstrider
bullet |1/day each:| commune with nature, freedom of movement, nondetection, tree stride

title: Far Darrig Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The far darrig makes four antler glaive attacks.

description |Antler Glaive| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or 10 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage and the target must make a successful DC 13 Strength saving throw or either be disarmed or fall prone; the attacking far darrig chooses which effect occurs.
description |Enchanted Glaive Maneuvers| A far darrig can magically extend or shrink its antler glaive as a bonus action to give it either a 10-foot or 5-foot reach.

title: Fate Eater
contents: property | Skills | Arcana +7, History +7, Insight +6, Religion +7
description |Innate Spellcasting| The fate eater's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

description |Visionary Flesh| Eating the flesh of a fate eater requires a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. If successful, the eater gains a divination spell. If failed, the victim vomits blood and fails the next saving throw made in combat.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic.

title: Fate Eater Continued: Actions
contents: description |Spectral Bite| On a critical hit against a target, it damages not only the creature but also the threads of its fate, changing the character's past or future. The target must roll 1d6 on the chart below for each critical hit that isn't negated by a successful DC 15 Charisma saving throw:
description |1- Seeing the Alternates:| Suffers effects of confusion spell for 1d4 rounds
description |2- Untied from the Loom:| Character's speed is randomized for 4 rounds. Roll 3d20 at the start of each of the character's turns to determine his or her speed in feet that turn
description |3- Shifting Memories:| Permanently loses 2 from a random skill and gains 2 in a random untrained skill
description |4- Not So Fast:| Loses the use of one class ability, random
description |5- Lost Potential:| Loses 1 point from one randomly chosen ability score
description |6- Took the Lesser Path:| The character's current hit point total becomes his or her hit point maximum

text |Effects 3-6 are permanent until the character makes a successful Charisma saving throw. The saving throw is repeated after every long rest, but the DC increases by 1 after every long rest, as the character becomes more entrenched in this new destiny. Otherwise, these new fates can be undone by nothing short of a wish spell or comparable magic.

title: Fear Smith
contents: property | Damage Resistances | All Physical from cold iron weapons

description |Distortion Gaze| Seeing the fear smith's eye and in 30ft, makes a DC 16 Wisdom save or become disoriented. While disoriented, the creature falls prone each time it tries to move or take the Dash or Disengage action. To recover from disorientation, a creature must start its turn outside the fear smith's gaze and makes DC 16 Wisdom save. Fear smith can't be incapacitated and must see the affected creature. Non-surprised creature can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the effect, no save is necessary but fear smith counts as invisible until the start of the creature's next turn. If during its turn the creature chooses to look at the fear smith, it must immediately make the saving throw.

title: Fear Smith Continued: Actions
contents: description |Hidden Eye| The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against the blinded condition.

description |Innate Spellcasting| The fear smith's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). The fear smith can innately cast the following spells, requiring no verbal or material components:
description |2/day each:| charm person, command, confusion
description |Magic Resistance| The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
description |Multiattack| The fear smith makes three claw attacks.

description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., 1 creature. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is disoriented by Distortion Gaze, this attack does an additional 13 (3d8) psychic damage and heals the fear smith by an equal amount.

description |Heartstopping Stare| The fear smith terrifies a creature within 30 feet with a look. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned for 1 round and take 13 (3d8) psychic damage and heal the fear smith by an equal amount.

title: Fellforged
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Poisoned
property | Language | Any languages it knew in life

description |Expelled Spirit| While the fellforged body was made to bind spirits, the wraith within is vulnerable to turning attempts. Any successful turn attempt exorcises the wraith from its clockwork frame. The expelled wraith retains its current hp total and fights normally. The construct dies without an animating spirit.
description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the fellforged has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

title: Fellforged Continued: Actions
contents: description |Unnatural Aura| All animals, whether wild or domesticated, can sense the unnatural presence of fellforged at a distance of 30 feet. They do not willingly approach nearer than that and panic if forced to do so, and they remain panicked as long as they are within that range.
description |Multiattack| The fellforged makes two necrotic slam attacks.

description |Necrotic Slam| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the total damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

description |Violent Escapement| With little regard for the clockwork bodies they inhabit, fellforged wraiths can stress and strain their mechanisms in such a violent manner that flywheels become unbalanced, gears shatter, and springs snap. As a bonus action, this violent burst of gears and pulleys deals 7 (2d6) piercing damage to all foes within 5 feet who fail a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. Each use of this ability imposes a cumulative reduction in movement of 5 feet upon the fellforged. If its speed is reduced to 0 feet, the fellforged becomes paralyzed.

title: Fext
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +6, Wis +4, Cha +7
property | Damage Resistances | Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Poisoned
property | Language | Any languages of its patron
description |Innate Spellcasting| The fext's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
bullet |3/day each:| counterspell, fear, gaseous form
bullet |1/day each:| hold monster, true seeing
description |Magic Resistance| The fext has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
description |Magic Weapons| The fext's weapon attacks are magical.

title: Fext Continued: Actions
contents: description |Patron Blessing| A fext is infused with a portion of their patron's power. They have an Armor Class equal to 10 + their Charisma modifier + their Dexterity modifier.
description |Multiattack| The fext makes two melee or ranged attacks.
description |Eldritch Blade| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.
description |Eldritch Fury| Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 60/200 ft., one creature. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

title: Bear King
contents: property | Saving Throws | Str +9, Dex +4, Wis +7
property | Damage Immunities | Poison; All Physical from cold iron weapons
property | Language | Common, Elvish, Giant, Sylvan

description |Alternate Form| As a bonus action, the Bear King can assume the form of a shaggy grizzly bear, or a hybrid of his humanoid and bear forms. In alternate form the Bear King's size increases to Large, and he can make bite and claw attacks. He remains in this form until he returns to human form as a bonus action or he falls unconscious or dies.
description |Keen Smell| Advantage on Perception checks based on smell.
description |Legendary Resistance (3/day)| Can succeed failed saves

title: Bear King Continued: Actions
contents: description |Regeneration (Alternate Form only)| Regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.
description |Multiattack| The bear king makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks. In hybrid or grizzly bear form he can also make one additional bite attack.

description |Bite (Grizzly or Hybrid Form Only)| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage. A target creature other than a construct or undead must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or lose 10 (3d6) hit points from blood loss. Each time the Bear King hits the wounded creature with this attack, the hit point loss increases by 10 (3d6). A creature can take an action to staunch the bleeding on itself or an adjacent ally with a successful DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The bleeding also stops if the creature receives any magical healing.
description |Claws (Grizzly or Hybrid Form Only)| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing.

description |Maul (Human or Hybrid Form Only)| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. Single. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning. A creature hit by two maul attacks in the same turn must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or fall prone.
description |Javelin (Human Form Only)| Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing.

title: Bear King Continued: Actions
contents: text |The Bear King can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Bear King regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
description |Melee Attack| The Bear King makes a claw or maul attack.

description |Honey Toss| The Bear King reaches into the jar he carries at his side and hurls a glob of honey at a target within 30 feet as a ranged weapon attack (+9 to hit). If the attack hits, the creature is restrained (escape DC 17).

description |Frightful Roar (2 actions)| The Bear King lets out a bloodcurdling roar. All creatures within 90 feet who can hear the Bear King must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature that makes its save, or who the effect ends for, is immune to the Frightful Roar for 24 hours. The bear king's allies are unaffected.

title: Lord of the Hunt
contents: property | Saving Throws | Str +11, Wis +10, Cha +8
property | Damage Resistances | All Physical from cold iron weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Exhaustion, Charmed, Frightened, Poisoned
property | Senses | Blindsight 10ft, Darkvision 60ft, Passive Perc. 20
property | Language | Common, Draconic, Elvish, Sylvan
description |Expert Rider| Mounted, attacks target the rider instead of mount. Steed has Lord of the Hunt's saves. Successful saving throw against a damaging effect, it takes no damage.
description |Innate Spellcasting| Spellcasting ability score is Charisma (save DC 16). The Lord of the Hunt can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
bullet |1/day:| conjure fey (conjured creatures vanish if the Lord of the Hunt's concentration is broken)

title: Lord of the Hunt Continued: Actions
contents: description |Legendary Resistance (3/day)| If the Lord of the Hunt fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
description |Magic Weapons| Weapon attacks are magical.
description |Multiattack| The Lord of the Hunt makes three melee attacks or ranged attacks

description |Huntsman's Spear| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage or 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage if used in two hands, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. As a bonus action, the Lord of the Hunt can cause his spear to magically appear in his hand, even if it is destroyed.
description |Howling Longbow| Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.
description |Parry| The Lord of the Hunt adds 6 to his AC against one attack that would hit him. To do so, he must see the attacker and must be wielding a melee weapon.

title: Lord of the Hunt Continued: Legendary
contents: text |The Lord of the Hunt can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Lord of the Hunt regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
description |Strike| The Lord of the Hunt makes a huntsman's spear attack or a howling longbow attack.
description |Tenacious Stride| The Lord of the Hunt moves half his speed, or half the speed of any steed he rides.

description |Call the Hunt (2 actions)| The Lord of the Hunt blows his hunting horn and chooses one creature he can see within 60 feet. If the creature can hear the horn, it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw against this magic or be charmed by the Lord of the Hunt for 8 hours. A charmed creature joins the wild hunt and follows the verbal instructions of the Lord of the Hunt, treating all former allies as enemies. If a charmed creature damages or is damaged by a former ally, it can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once a creature successfully saves or the effect ends for it, it is immune to Call the Hunt for the next 24 hours.

title: Moonlight King
contents: property | Saving Throws | Con +10, Wis +10, Cha +11
property | Damage Resistances | Acid; All Physical from cold iron weapons
property | Damage Immunities | Cold, Fire, Poison
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Poisoned
property | Senses | Blindsight 30ft, Darkvision 120ft, Passive Perc. 20
property | Language | Abyssal, Celestial, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Infernal, Umbral; Telepathy 100 ft.
description |Control Moonlight| Bonus action, the Moonlit King can cause all areas of moonlight within 100 feet to move up to 10 feet.
description |Innate Spellcasting| Innate spellcasting ability score is Charisma (DC19, +11 to hit). The Moonlit King can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
bullet |At will:| continual flame, detect evil and good, invisibility (self only), moonbeam, zone of truth
bullet |3/day each:| blight, dispel evil and good, dispel magic

title: Moonlight King Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Legendary Resistance (3/day). If the Moonlit King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
description |Magic Weapons| The Moonlit King's weapon attacks are magical, and deal an extra 7 (2d6) radiant damage (included below).
description |Multiattack| The Moonlit King makes three attacks with either his crystal staff or his moon bolt.

description |Crystal Staff| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) radiant damage. A target that is struck by the staff two or more times in one turn must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

description |Moon Bolt| Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d10) radiant damage. If the target is a creature in a form other than its natural form, it takes an additional 22 (4d10) radiant damage and must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or revert to its natural form. When the moon bolt hits a target, moonlight glows in a 10-foot radius from that point, creating dim light. The light is stationary and lasts until the end of the Moonlit King's next turn.

title: Moonlight King Continued: Actions
contents: description |Fearful Shadows (Recharge 5-6)| The Moonlit King magically animates the shadows of all foes within 60 feet of himself. The animated shadows attack the creatures who cast them. All affected creatures in the area take 35 (10d6) necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. A creature that fails the saving throw also loses 1d4 points from its Strength score. A creature reduced to 0 Strength is unconscious until it regains at least 1 point of Strength. Strength lost to fearful shadows returns when the creature finishes a short or long rest.

description |Summon Devil (1/Day)| The Moonlit King magically summons a lunar devil. The summoned devil appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other devils. It remains for 10 minutes, until its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

description |Shadow Slip| The Moonlit King takes on the quality of his manifest delusions when he is targeted by an attacker he can see. He becomes nearly insubstantial, so that the attack roll is made with disadvantage. If the attack hits, the Moonlit King takes half damage.

title: Moonlight King Continued: Legendary
contents: text |The Moonlit King can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Moonlit King regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
description |Staff| The Moonlit King makes a crystal staff attack.
description |Lightwalking| The Moonlit King teleports from one area of moonlight to another within 100 feet.

description |Aura of Madness (2 actions)| While he is standing in an area of moonlight, the Moonlit King can spread his madness to other creatures within 30 feet. A creature other than a fiend that starts its turn in the aura or enters it for the first time on a turn (including when the aura is created) must succeed on a DC 19 Charisma saving throw or be confused (as if affected by the confusion spell) until the start of its next turn. The aura lasts until the start of the Moonlit King's next turn.

title: Queen of Night and Magic
contents: property | Armor class | 15 (18 with mage armor)
property | Skills | Arcana +12, Deception +15, Intimidation +15, Perception +11, Stealth +12
property | Damage Immunities | Cold; All Physical from cold iron
property | Language | Celestial, Common, Elvish, Sylvan, Umbral; Telepathy 120ft
description |Legendary Resistance (3/day)| Failing a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.
description |Magic Resistance| Has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
description |Shadowborn| When in lighting other than bright light, the Queen of Night and Magic has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and she can hide even while being observed.

title: Queen of Night and Magic Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Spellcasting| The Queen of Night and Magic is an 18th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 23, +15 to hit with spell attacks). The Queen knows the following sorcerer spells:
bullet |Cantrips (at will):| blade ward, chill touch, dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost
bullet |5th level (3 slots):| cone of cold, teleportation circle
description |Multiattack| The Queen of Night and Magic makes three attacks with her rapier or with star strike.
description |Rapier| Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

title: Queen of Night and Magic Continued: Actions
contents: description |Shadow Rift (Recharge 5-6)| The Queen of Night and Magic creates a shadowy rift in a 20-foot sphere centered on a point she can see within 150 feet. Any creature within the rift takes 72 (16d8) cold damage, or half damage with a successful DC 23 Constitution saving throw. Creatures that fail the saving throw are also restrained by icy wisps of shadow. A restrained creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the restrained condition on a success.
description |Star Strike| Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.
description |Teleport| The Queen of Night and Magic teleports to an unoccupied space up to 60 feet away.

description |Unravel| Targets a creature, object, or magical effect that she can see. For every spell affecting the target, the Queen makes a Charisma check; the DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell is dispelled.

description |Sudden Fraying| When the Queen of Night and Magic is targeted by a spell or included in a spell's area, she can use her Unravel ability on it. The Queen does not need to see a spell to target it with this reaction, but she must be able to see at least some portion of an area or object affected by the spell.

title: Queen of Night and Magic Continued: Legendary
contents: text |The Queen of Night and Magic can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Queen of Night and Magic regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.
description |Cantrip| The Queen of Night and Magic casts a cantrip.
description |Swirling Stars| The Queen of Night and Magic makes one star strike attack. Having a foe within 5 feet of the Queen doesn't cause this attack to be made with disadvantage.
description |Teleport| The Queen of Night and Magic uses her Teleport ability.
description |Spell (2 actions)| The Queen of Night and Magic casts a spell.

title: Queen Of Witches
contents: property | Skills | Arcana +9, Dec. +12, His. +9, Insight +10, Perc. +10
property | Damage Resistances | Fire, Cold; All Physical from cold iron
property | Condition Immunities | Blinded, Charmed, Frightened
property | Language | Celestial, Common, Draconic, Elvish, Sylvan, Umbral
description |Absorb the Weave| When Nicnevin counters or dispels a spell, she heals damage equal to twice the spell level.
description |Innate Spellcasting| Ability is Charisma (DC19, +12). Innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
bullet |3/day each:| chain lightning, counterspell, dispel magic, hypnotic pattern, teleportation circle
bullet |2/day each:| bestow curse, feeblemind, mass suggestion, flesh to stone

title: Queen Of Witches: Abilities
contents: description |Magic Resistance| Nicnevin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
description |Legendary Resistance (3/day)| If Nicnevin fails a saving throw she can choose to succeed instead.

description |Token of Favor| As an action, Nicnevin can cut a lock of her copper hair and twist it into a token for a creature she chooses. As long as that creature carries the token, it gains the magic resistance trait (see above). Nicnevin can revoke her favor at any time as a bonus action. When that happens, the creature loses the benefit of the token and, if Nicnevin wishes, the creature also has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects for 24 hours.
description |Multiattack| Nicnevin makes two attacks, or makes one attack and casts a spell.
description |Moonsilver Ring| Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage. The moonsilver ring is a magical weapon.

description |Blast| Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) force damage. A creature hit by a blast must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet directly away from Nicnevin.

title: Queen Of Witches Continued: Legendary
contents: text |Nicnevin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Nicnevin regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
description |Spell (2 actions)| Nicnevin casts a spell.
description |Teleport| Nicnevin magically teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within 40 feet.

title: River King
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +8, Con +10, Wis +6
property | Skills | Intimidation +8, Nature +7, Perception +6, Stealth +8
property | Damage Resistances | Fire, Cold, Thunder; All Physical from cold iron weapons
property | Senses | Darkvision 60ft, Blindsight 10ft, Passive Perc. 16
property | Language | Common, Elemental, Elvish, Giant
description |Amphibious| The River King can breathe air and water.

description |Innate Spellcasting| The River King's innate spellcasting ability score is Charisma (save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The River King can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
bullet |At will:| create or destroy water, shocking grasp, water breathing

title: River King: Actions
contents: description |Legendary Resistance (3/day)| If the River King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
description |Magic Weapons| The River King's weapon attacks are magical and do an extra 10 (3d6) lightning damage (included below).
description |Multiattack| The River King makes three attacks with his longsword and/or flood blast, in any combination.

description |Longsword| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage or 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

description |Flood Blast| Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage. A target creature must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and pushed up to 60 feet at the River King's choosing.

title: River King Continued: Reactions
contents: description |Grasping Whirlpool (Recharge 5-6)| The River King magically creates a swirling vortex of water centered on a point he can see within 60 feet. The vortex fills a cylinder with a 10-foot radius and 15 feet high. Creatures in the area must make a successful DC 16 Strength saving throw or take 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage and be restrained and unable to breathe. On a successful save, the creature is pushed to the edge of the area. A restrained creature can escape from the whirlpool by using an action to make a successful DC 16 Strength check. A creature that's in the whirlpool at the end of its turn takes 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage in addition to any effects from being unable to breathe. Creatures with a swim speed have advantage on the saving throw and the Strength check to escape. The whirlpool lasts for 1 minute or until the River King uses this ability again.
description |Blade Current| When a creature within the River King's melee reach stands up from prone, the River King can make a longsword attack on that creature with advantage.

title: River King Continued: Legendary
contents: text |The River King can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The River King regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
description |Longsword| The River King makes a longsword attack.
description |Flow| The River King moves half his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
description |Ripple (2 Actions)| The River King magically ripples like sunlight on the surface of water. Until the start of his next turn, all attacks against him have disadvantage.

title: Snow Queen
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +9, Con +7, Cha +9
property | Damage Resistances | All Physical from cold iron weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Exhaustion
property | Senses | Darkvision 60ft, Blindsight 10ft, Passive Perc. 20
property | Language | Common, Elvish, Giant, Sylvan

description |Innate Spellcasting| The Snow Queen's innate spellcasting ability score is Charisma (save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The Snow Queen can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.
bullet |At will:| fog cloud, magic missile, ray of frost
bullet |3/day each:| chill metal (as heat metal, but does cold damage), freezing sphere
description |Legendary Resistance (3/day)| If the Snow Queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

title: Snow Queen: Actions
contents: description |Magic Weapons| The Snow Queen's weapon attacks are magical and do an extra 7 (2d6) cold damage (included below).
description |Winter Step| The Snow Queen ignores difficult terrain caused by ice and snow. She can walk on vertical and horizontal surfaces that are covered by ice or snow.
description |Multiattack| The Snow Queen makes two attacks in any combination of her claws and her ice crown.
description |Claws| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

description |Ice Crown| Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range 80/320ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

description |Cold Snap (Recharge 5-6)| The Snow Queen causes the temperature around her to drop dramatically. Every creature within 30 feet of the Snow Queen must make a successful DC 17 Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of exhaustion. Immunity to cold grants immunity to Cold Snap.

title: Snow Queen Continued: Legendary
contents: description |Frozen Shards| When the Snow Queen is hit by a melee attack, she can strike her attacker with shards from her icy crown. The attacker takes 11 (2d10) piercing damage and 11 (2d10) cold damage, or no damage with a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw.

text |The Snow Queen can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Snow Queen regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.
description |Ice Crown| The Snow Queen makes an ice crown attack.
description |Snowblind| One target that the Snow Queen can see within 100 feet must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be blinded by swirling snow until the end of its next turn.

description |Snowfall Mantle (2 Actions)| The Snow Queen throws her mantle of snow at a point she can see within 60 feet. An area within 30 feet of that point instantly becomes covered in deep snow. Creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be restrained. The area becomes difficult terrain, costing 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved. The difficult terrain lasts until the end of the Snow Queen's next turn, at which time her mantle returns to her shoulders.

title: Feyward Tree
contents: property | Saving Throws | Con +7, Wis +3, Cha +1
property | Damage Imm. | Poison, Psychic; Physical: non-adamantine
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
description |Magic Resistance| A feyward tree has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

description |Contractibility and Conductivity| Certain spells and effects function differently against feyward trees:
- Cold damage, from magic, slows tree (like slow) for 3 rnds.
Lightning damage from magic breaks any slow effect on the feyward tree and heals 1 hit point for each 3 damage the attack would otherwise deal. If the amount of healing would cause the tree to exceed its full normal hp, it gains excess as temporary hp. Gets no saves against lightning effects.

title: Feyward Tree Continued: Actions
contents: description |Immutable Form| The feyward tree is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
description |Magic Weapons| The feyward tree's weapon attacks are magical.
description |Warden's Reach| Creatures within 15 feet of a feyward tree provoke opportunity attacks even if they take the Disengage action before leaving its reach.
description |Multiattack| The tree makes two razor-leafed branch attacks, and may use a bonus action to make a razor-leafed branch attack against any creature standing next to it.
description |Razor-Leafed Branch| Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage.

description |Flaying Leaves (Recharge 5-6)| The tree can launch a barrage of razor-sharp cold iron leaves from its branches in a 20-footradius burst. All creatures caught within this area must make a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 21 (6d6) slashing damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

title: Firebird
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +6, Con +4, Int +5, Wis +4, Cha +7
property | Skills | Acrobatics +6, Arcana +5, Insight +4, Medicine +4, Nature +5, Perception +7, Religion +5
property | Damage Resistances | Lightning; Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Invisible
property | Language | Celestial, Common, Elvish, Primordial, Sylvan
description |Innate Spellcasting| The firebird's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
bullet |At will:| guidance, purify food and drink, speak with animals
bullet |3/day each:| charm person, cure wounds (2d8 + 5), daylight, faerie fire, heat metal, hypnotic pattern, tongues

title: Firebird Continued: Actions
contents: description |Light of the World| The firebird's feathers glow with a warm light. The creature sheds light as dim as a candle or as bright as a lantern. It always sheds light, and any feathers plucked from the creature continue to shed light as a torch.

description |Warming Presence| The firebird and any creatures within a 5-foot radius are immune to the effects of natural, environmental cold. Invited into a home or building, a firebird can expand this warming presence to its inhabitants no matter how close they are to the creature.
description |Multiattack| The firebird makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

description |Blinding Ray (Recharge 5-6)| The firebird can fire a burning ray of light from its tail feathers in a line 5 feet wide and up to 50 feet long. Targets in the line must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 24 (7d6) fire damage and become blinded for 1d4 rounds. A successful saving throw negates the blindness and reduces the damage by half.

title: Firegeist
contents: property | Condition Immunities | Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious
description |Hide By Firelight| In an area lit only by nonmagical flame, a Firegeist gains a +2 bonus on Stealth checks. This becomes +4 when hiding within the fire.
description |Illumination| The firegeist sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.
description |Magical Light Sensitivity| While in magical light, the firegeist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.
description |Water Susceptibility| For every 5 feet the firegeist moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 3 cold damage.

title: Firegeist Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The firegeist makes two slam attacks.
description |Slam| Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

description |Combustion Touch (Recharge 5-6)| The firegeist may ignite a target when making a slam attack. The target must immediately succeed at a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or catch fire, taking an additional 5 (1d10) fire damage at the beginning of its next turn. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

title: Flutterflesh
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Cold, Lightning; Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Paralyzed, Exhaustion, Poison, Stunned, Unconscious
description |Magic Weapons| The flutterflesh's attacks are magical.
description |Turn Resistance| The flutterflesh has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.
description |Creeping Death| A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the flutterflesh must make a successful DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

title: Flutterflesh Continued: Actions
contents: description |Regeneration| The flutterflesh regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the flutterflesh takes radiant or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The flutterflesh dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.
description |Multiattack| The flutterflesh makes two bone spur attacks or two tormenting gaze attacks.

description |Bone Spur| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If both attacks hit a single creature in the same turn, it is grappled (escape DC 10). As a bonus action, the flutterflesh can choose whether this attack does bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

description |Tormenting Gaze| A target creature within 120 feet and able to see the flutterflesh takes 18 (4d8) psychic damage and is paralyzed for 1d4 rounds, or takes half damage and isn't paralyzed with a successful DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. Tormenting gaze can't be used against the same target twice in a single turn.

description |Slash| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. On a critical hit, the target takes an additional 27 (5d10) slashing damage and must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the flutterflesh lops off and absorbs one of the target's limbs (chosen randomly) and heals hit points equal to the additional slashing damage it inflicted.

title: Folk of Leng
contents: description |Innate Spellcasting| The folk of Leng's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

title: Folk of Leng Continued: Actions
contents: description |Regeneration| The folk of Leng regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the folk of Leng takes fire or radiant damage, this trait does not function at the start of its next turn. The folk of Leng dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and does not regenerate. Even if slain, their bodies reform in a crypt of Leng and go on about their business.
description |Void Stare| Sees through doors and around corners as a bonus action. As a result, they are very rarely surprised.
description |Void Sailors| Travels the airless void without harm.

description |Etheric Harpoon| Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) necrotic damage, and the target must make a successful DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be grappled (escape DC 13). In addition, armor has no effect against the attack roll of an etheric harpoon; only the Dexterity modifier factored into the target's AC is considered.
description |Psychic Scimitar| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

description |Hooked Spider Net (Recharge 5-6)| Ranged Weapon Attack. +4 to hit, range 20/50 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage plus 19 (3d12) poison damage, and the target is restrained. A successful DC 14 Constitution saving throw halves the poison damage.

title: Forest Marauder
contents: description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in sunlight, the forest marauder has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Multiattack| Marauder makes two boar spear attacks.

description |Boar Spear| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit:16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the forest marauder can choose to push the target 10 feet away if it fails a DC 16 Strength saving throw.
description |Rock| Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

title: Fraughashar
contents: description |Frost Walker| The fraughashar's speed is unimpeded by rocky, snowy, or icy terrain. It never needs to make Dexterity checks to move or avoid falling prone because of icy or snowy ground.
description |Multiattack| Makes one bite attack and one dagger attack.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing.
description |Dagger| Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing.
description |Sling| Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

title: Frostevil
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Prone

description |Chilling Acid| The frostveil's frozen acidic mist breaks down flesh and organic materials into useable nutrients. Creatures who strike the frostveil with a non-reach melee weapon or an unarmed strike take 4 (1d8) acid damage.
description |False Appearance| While the frostveil remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a formation of frost and ice.
description |Windborne| While in blowing wind, the frostveil can fly with a speed of 30 feet. In a strong wind this speed increases to 60 feet.

title: Frostevil Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The frostveil makes three tendril attacks.
description |Tendril| Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If two tendrils hit the same target in a single turn, the target is engulfed.

description |Engulf| When a frostveil wraps itself around a Medium or smaller creature, the target takes 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage and is grappled (escape DC 15). The target takes another 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage at the end of each of its turns when it's still grappled by the frostveil. A frostveil can't attack while it has a creature engulfed. Damage from attacks against the frostveil is split evenly between the frostveil and the engulfed creature; the only exceptions are slashing and psychic damage, which affect only the frostveil.

description |Spirit Spores (recharge 6)| In distress, frostveils release a puff of psychotropic spores in a 10-foot cloud around themselves. Creatures within the cloud of spores must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw against poison or suffer hallucinations, as per a confusion spell, for 1d3 rounds.

title: Garroter Crab
contents: description |Amphibious| The crab can breathe air and water.

description |Whip-claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 8). While grappled, the target cannot speak or cast spells with verbal components.

title: Gbahali (Postosuchus)
contents: description |Chameleon Hide| The gbahali has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the gbahali moves one-half its speed or less, attacks made against it before the start of the gbahali's next turn have disadvantage.
description |Multiattack| The gbahali makes one bite attack and two claw attacks.

description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d12 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the gbahali can't bite another target.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

title: Gearforged Templar
contents: property | Damage Resistances | Physical from non-magical weapons
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Frightened, Exhaustion, Poisoned
description |Defensive Zone| The gearforged templar can make an opportunity attack when a creature enters its reach.
description |Onslaught| As a bonus action, the gearforged can make a Shove attack.

title: Gearforged Templar Continued: Actions
contents: description |Multiattack| The gearforged templar makes three attacks with its glaive.
description |Glaive| Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) slashing damage.
description |Javelin| Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

description |Whirlwind (recharge 5-6)| The gearforged templar whirls its glaive in a great arc. Every creature within 10 feet of the gearforged takes 16 (3d10) slashing damage, or half damage with a successful DC 16 Dexterity saving throw.

description |Parry| The gearforged templar raises its AC by 3 against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gearforged must be able to see the attacker and must be wielding a melee weapon.

title: Al-Aeshma Genie
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +6, Wis +7, Cha +9
description |Air Hatred| The al-Aeshma has advantage on attack rolls against airborne opponents.

description |Bound| The al-Aeshma must always be anchored to the earth. Even in gaseous form or sandstorm form, part of it must always touch the ground. The al-Aeshma's maximum altitude while flying is 50 ft. If it is not touching, it loses its immunities and gains vulnerability to lightning and thunder.
description |Elemental Demise| When an al-Aeshma dies, its body disintegrates into a swirling spray of coarse sand, leaving behind equipment it was wearing or carrying.

title: Al-Aeshma Genie Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Ill Wind| As a bonus action when in gaseous form, the al.Aeshma can befoul its space with a choking scent. When the al-Aeshma moves through another creature's space in gaseous form, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn. Ill Wind lasts until the al-Aeshma leaves gaseous form or chooses to end the ability as a bonus action.
description |Innate Spellcasting| The al-Aeshma's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
description |At will:| detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave
description |3/day each:| destroy food and water (as create food and water, but makes food and drink unpalatable), tongues, wind walk
description |1/day each:| creation, gaseous form, insect plague, invisibility, major image

description |Regeneration| The al-Aeshma regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The al.Aeshma dies only if it starts its turn at 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

title: Al-Aeshma Genie Continued: Legendary
contents: description |Multiattack| The al-Aeshma makes three scimitar attacks.
description |Scimitar| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

description |Dust Devil| A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of sand magically forms on a point the al-Aeshma can see within 120 feet of it. The dust devil lasts as long as the al-Aeshma maintains concentration (as if a spell). Any creature but the al-Aeshma that enters the dust devil must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained by it; any number of creatures may be restrained this way. At the start of a restrained creature's turn, it takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The al-Aeshma can move the dust devil up to 60 feet as an action; restrained creatures move with it. The dust devil ends if the al-Aeshma loses sight of it. A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the dust devil, including itself, by making a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, it moves to the nearest space outside the dust devil.

title: Gerridae
contents: description |Bred to the Saddle| Gerridae do not take any penalties to their movement or speed due to encumbrance or carrying a single rider.

description |Waterborne| Any gerridae can run while on the surface of water, but not while on land or climbing. They treat stormy water as normal rather than difficult terrain. A gerridae takes one point of damage for every hour spent on dry land.
description |Multiattack| The gerridae makes one bite attack and one claw attack.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.
description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

title: Beggar Ghoul
contents: property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Poisoned
description |Pack Tactics| Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beggar ghoul's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
description |Savage Hunger| Hits with its bite attack against a creature that hasn't acted yet in this combat scores a critical hit.
description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

description |Claws| Melee: +4, 5ft, Single. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, makes DC 10 Constitution save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on save

title: Bonepowder Ghoul
contents: property | Saving Throws | Dex +9, Con +8, Wis +6, Cha +8
property | Damage Resistances | Cold, Lightning; Physical: non-magical
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Poisoned
property | Language | Common, Darakhul, Draconic, Dwarvish
description |Amorphous| The bonepowder ghoul can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

description |Coalesce| Whenever draining life force from victims with Gravedust, it can use that energy transform its shape into a more solid form and maintain it. The new form is Small and semi-transparent but roughly the shape of a normal ghoul. In this form, the ghoul isn't amorphous and can't form a whirlwind, but it can speak normally and manipulate objects. The altered form lasts for 1 minute for every point of necrotic damage it delivered against living foes.

title: Bonepowder Ghoul Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Turning Defiance| It and any other ghouls in 30ft of it have advantage on save against effects that turn undead.

description |Innate Spellcasting| Innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
bullet |At will:| chill touch, darkness, dispel magic, ray of enfeeblement

description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) plus 1d4 Strength damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1d4 + 1 rounds. If humanoid, it makes second DC 19 Constitution save or contract darakhul fever.

description |Gravedust| A bonepowder ghoul can project a 40-ft. cone of grave dust. All targets within the area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw to avoid taking 4d8 necrotic damage, and must make a second DC 17 Constitution saving throw to avoid being infected with darakhul fever.

description |Whirlwind (Recharge 5-6)| A bonepowder ghoul can generate a whirlwind of bones and teeth. All creatures within a 20-foot cube take 66 (12d10) slashing damage and are drained of 1d6 Strength; a successful DC 17 Dexterity saving throw reduces damage to half and negates the Strength loss. The whirlwind dissipates after one round.

title: Darakhul Ghoul
contents: property | Armor class | 16 (scale mail; 18 with shield)
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhastion, Poisoned

description |Master of Disguise| A darakhul in a prepared disguise has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to pass as a living creature. While using this ability, the darakhul loses its stench.

description |Stench| Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the darakhul must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. A successful saving throw makes the creature immune to the darakhul's stench for 24 hours. A darakhul using this ability can't also benefit from Master of Disguise.

title: Darakhul Ghoul Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Sunlight Sensitivity| Disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on attack rolls while it, the object it is trying to see or attack in direct sunlight.
description |Turning Defiance| The darakhul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.
description |Multiattack| The darakhul bites once, claws once, and makes one war pick attack. Using a shield limits the darakhul to making either its claw or war pick attack, but not both.

description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target creature is humanoid it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever.

description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must make a successful DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A  paralyzed target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a humanoid creature is paralyzed for 2 or more rounds (the victim fails at least 2 saving throws), consecutive or nonconsecutive, the creature contracts darakhul fever.
description |War Pick| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

title: Emperor of the Ghouls
contents: property | Skills | Deception +11, Insight +9, Perc. +9, Persuasion +11
property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Poisoned
property | Language | Cmn, Darakhul, Draconic, Gnoll, Undercommon
description |Legendary Resistance (3/day)| If the emperor fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.
description |Sunlight Sensitivity| While in direct sunlight, the emperor has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
description |Turn Resistance| The emperor has advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

title: Emperor of the Ghouls Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Spellcasting| 17th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting attribute is Charisma (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks). The emperor knows the following sorcerer spells:
bullet |Cantrips (at will):| blade ward, chill touch, message, prestidigitation, shocking grasp, true strike
description |Multiattack| One bite attack and two claw attacks. He can make one attack with its scepter in place of a claw attack.

description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and a creature must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever (see page 215).

description |Claw| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage, and a creature must make a successful DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed creature repeats the saving throw at the ends of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

title: Emperor of the Ghouls Continued: Legendary
contents: description |Scepter| Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (5d6) necrotic damage.
description |Blood Armor| When the emperor takes damage from a creature it can see within 60 feet, the attacker takes necrotic damage equal to half the damage it did to the emperor.

text |The Emperor can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Emperor regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.
description |Attack| The emperor makes one claw or bite attack.
description |Cantrip| The emperor casts a cantrip.
description |Font of Power (3 actions)| Roll 1d8. The emperor regains a spell slot of that level or lower.

title: Imperial Ghoul
contents: property | Condition Immunities | Charmed, Exhaustion, Poisoned
description |Turning Defiance| The imperial ghoul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.
description|Multiattack| The imperial ghoul makes one bite attack and one claws attack.

description |Bite| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage, and if the target creature is humanoid it must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or contract darakhul fever.

title: Imperial Ghoul Continued: Abilities
contents: description |Claws| Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach, one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) slashing damage.
